subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Why Egyptian Religion Died
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Why Egyptian Religion Died.

hook.text: For 3,000 years, Egyptians worshipped their gods. Then Christianity arrived, temples closed, and the old faith vanished.

buildup.text: Roman Emperor Theodosius banned pagan worship in 391 CE. Egyptian temples were closed, defaced, or converted.

discovery.text: The last known hieroglyphic inscription dates to 394 CE. When the script died, so did the ability to read the religion.

twist.text: Egyptian religion didn't die from lack of believers. It died because the state crushed it. Power kills gods.

climax.text: A faith that lasted 3,000 years was erased in a century. No religion is permanent when the state turns against it.

punchline.text: 3,000 years of gods, erased in a century. Power kills even ancient faiths.

quiz.question: What caused the end of ancient Egyptian religion?
options: Roman imperial bans on pagan worship
